title: How did you all Climb out of B5?
body:
I've been trying to climb out, i get to about 60lp then just get either 2 afkers, teams that wont group.
Like last game, we aced them, at mid Inhib tower.. instead of getting that they all ran off to get the dragon

Game before, we aced them, me and ADC pushed mid up got tower inhib 1 nexus tower and the rest of team farmed jungle
I really cant get a team to just play together.

5 v 5 in mid.. I ult in as wukong.. Yasuo looks a tm e and backs off. his ult was up. nothing
The teams wont ward rivers or bushes or jungles
Noone upgrades trickets
Noone buys pinks

I understand people say to play a carry, ive been trying ADC or top riven. but its the team play i just cant get to work.

I never yell or be toxic, instead o usually go, Alright lets group and push mid as a 5 man..
or lets get dragon guys
and my response is STFU Noob 
How did you all get out? how did you get them to work as a team?

I know i probably belong in B5 which is why im there but im trying to get out :(

replies.body:
It is a lot different getting out of bronze V this season, from when I did back in S4 (heck, its even completely different from climbing out last season).

**1. Join a premade team.**
Bronze V is the ultimate cesspit for trolls and people who play like bots. Playing ranked is like dipping your hand into medical waste and hoping you don't get hepatitis. Playing as a ranked 5 will definitely lessen your chances of being matched with trollers/afks/other toxins. It also allows you to become familiar with the play patterns of your teammates (so you don't have to keep adjusting your style every game) and you have way better communication. With the implementation of a dynamic queue where this is possible, there is literally no reason not to. You also get lots of cool bonuses like extra IP, mastery points and Hextech stuff (soon™).

**2. Play comfort picks rather than counter picks.**
A lot of people in bronze get caught up in trying to play counter picks, even if they have no idea how to play the champion. Same happens when the "FOTM OP" isn't banned. A lot of people are going to be playing "op" champs in order to get out, and the likelihood of them sucking is high (look at all the bronze v vaynes and yasuos). Playing a comfort pick means that you will not only have better matchup and skill knowledge, it means that you have more options on how you want to play (aggro/safe/roam). Keep in mind that your comfort picks may be banned, I would suggest picking up a couple of champs (also helpful if you are last pick and your team is missing something like a tank).

**3. Get super good at two roles.**
Dynamic queue allows you to choose two roles, so you have 100% chance of getting of your fave/best roles. Pick up a few comfort champs in each, learn all there is to know about them so you know things like build paths and matchups like the back of your hand. 

**4. Revisit some of the basic league skills.**
Things like [CS](http://imgur.com/orWUCKH), [warding](http://www.mobafire.com/league-of-legends/build/support-guide-map-control-warding-344910), positioning, [teamcomps](http://www.liquidlegends.net/forum/lol-strategy/476270-picks-and-bans-understanding-team-compositions), and [being a nice person and encouraging your team](http://gameinfo.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/). If you need help with some of this, you could[ consider hiring a coach](http://www.lol-coaching.com). 

_Note: also check your masteries and rune pages are the best they can be._

**5. Keep a ranked diary. **
Most of my improvement comes from my ranked diary. After every game I write down who I was playing, my score, CS, wards placed, LP gained/lost and a quick summary of the game. I also like to write down 3 things I did well, and 3 things I need to improve. That way, you are really processing the game and learning from your mistakes. It also gives you something to consciously work towards improving in the next game. 

Good luck, may the elo be ever in your favour ♥
This is a really helpful post, thank you!

Mate I've tried.  Bronze people seem to worry about their kda more.  Again we kill 4 people in mid. Instead of pushing mid and getting towers they feel it's better to 4 man chase the last one alive through jungle and then when everyone spawns they decide its a good time to push
Why the fuck are people so useless
I don't care as much about the feeder or afk. Its tjat people won't group to push rather chase through unwarded jungle

It would be nice to get more then one win :(

Try playing a strong pusher or a split pusher. Wait for your team to play the fight and use TP to split push once you get the ace.

Or get Zz'rot, the portal its self is like 2 champions together helping you push imo. And they are incredibly annoying to kill or face.

Been trying this.  They were all mid fighting.  I pushed bot but warded jungle. . Got their second tower bot and wards picked up three people coming.I went Iin the little bush and tped to top. They used so many abilities on the bush and Igot top Iinhib tower and team got mid inhib

And did it win the game for you?

I find split pushers and certainly strong split pushing champs who split push win more games than team push ever does.

You can't read it when you even quoted it?
this made my day

When you play ranked, there are games you are guaranteed to lose, but everyone forgets these happen to the enemy team too! 

If your skill is simply **on par** with (not better than) your division, then the odds are already in your favour: there are four strangers on your team and five on the enemy team - that's a higher chance of THEM drawing a less skilled player.

Now consider marginal games, the ones that could go either way. By playing at your average division skill, by definition you will win half of these games. By playing better you win more, and playing worse means you win less (this is how professionals carry so hard in low elo). 

Anyway, by this logic simply playing **at the same skill of your division** is enough to get you **at least** a 50% winrate - and that's enough to climb. So ultimately the key to climbing for the Average Joe is _consistency_. Play well, play often and you will rise :)

NB: This logic changes for Platinum and the competitive tiers. 
BG: I've carried several accounts through Bronze/Silver/Gold.

This is how I got from bronze to gold. Back in season 4 I was bronze 4 as was my classmate. We were both really dominant in lane (mid mains) but looking back, the reason we lost games were that we didn't know how to carry the team and teamfights. Back then silver was like plat to us. In the s5 preseason I climbed with ap control mages (good for lategame) like syndra and kat and got to silver 2. When the s5 finally began I was placed back into bronze 4.  I climbed again to silver using syndra/ahri/kat and when the end of the season was nearing, I knew I had to get season rewards. Trinity force yasuo carried me into gold and when preseason 6 began, I went up to gold 2 with leblanc (I usually w,r,q and e to single and assassinate a target making the next teamfight 4v5 or taking objectives while they don't fight). So anyways, to get out of bronze, you gotta play easy champions that have a lategame (cause bronzies dunno how to end) and champions u are used to. In lane, try adapting to ur enemy, eg. when I was playing leblanc against galio (and galio is lb's supposedly biggest counter because of his magic resist) I auto atked him half-dead and dodged his spells getting a 2/0 before 12 minutes. In teamfights, try positioning well (as kat I w8 for the moment when they are low so I can reset and pentakill em although u have to have fast fingers and just know what to do in situations as her).

Now the mindset in order to climb. Back in the day I always blamed my bad teams for me not climbing, the truth is in bronze, you cant do decent and expect to win most of the time. You have to be able to carry. If you aren't carrying and just doing decent in bronze 5, that means you aren't skilled enough and deserve to be in bronze 5. On the other hand, if you dominate the laning phase but just have a few flaws in positioning and teamfighting (like former me) you'll be sure to climb after you touch up on a few aspects (trust me, I went into bronze 4 promos 5 times before going on a winning streak and up to silver 3 and later to gold). If this helped you or if you have something to say, pls leave a comment as I really like reading responses

cheers, im planning on learning mid main and maybe top secondary or adc.

I usued to be ahri brand kennen
but that was a while ago
wouldnt mind learning and mastering ahri (one of my favs) fizz talon, zed (maybe he seems to get banned alot)
and for top i was thinking Riven, nasus, wukong

Fizz, talon and zed are really easy to mess up with. For mid, id suggest something easy like annie (ahri is still fine but hard to snowball with). As for top nasus is freelo, stack q in laning phase, if the opponent is ad, build armor, if the opponent is ap build magic resist and u get a  free farm lane. Ask you jungler to help you with high damage dealers and after a few tank items, he wont be doing nothing to you. You gotta know how to farm and cs doe cause that's really important as nasus. Riven takes time to get used to, countered by tanky top laners and has little mobility. Wukong is a fairly good pickup (just remember to build half tanky doe).

Adding to mid laners, im playing a lot of zed atm but im messing up quite a bit too so I recommend something else for the lower elo. Brand is a bit weak atm. Lux is really strong so picking her and ahri are a good choice

I was Bronze 3 last season and i wanted to get to silver 5 really bad before the season ended so i started watching pro streamers like imqtpie hes adc main as was I. I listen to his tips and advice i watched youtube vids on how to control the waves, how to position myself in team fights shit like that i climbed from bronze 3 to silver 5 in 3 days then just played heaps during preseasonand got to silver 1  season 6 came i got silver 4 off my promos and its been almost a month and a half and i climbed from silver 4 to plat 5 its just practice man idk if this was helpful but i felt like sharing haha

I guess this is a slightly different case, but still relevant!

When we were on NA during season 1, I was stuck just above 1000 elo (not very highly rated), I started taking the game more seriously when I got better than all of my friends and on a whim really committed to improvement! The trick was simple, play a set group of champions, in your set role/s, with a set group of serious(and fun) friends!
Every death you have is a mistake you work on next time, there's always something to learn! 
Did I just get 5 manned with TP's? Probably was a bit over extended or took a fight knowing it was up.

The easiest thing to do is play 1/2 champions until you absolutely wreck with them. Then your mechanics are there, from there you need to focus on decision making with mechanics, because you can't lee kick someone to your team, if the team isn't there! 

Rules of thumb (even in master): 
- Baron is a throwpit unless they are all dead, better to not do it.
- Champions with dashes are better champions for SoloQ
- Invisibility champions can catch people so easily because they forget you could be anywhere. (Evelynn is OP in Soloq!)
- Pink wards are OP! Place them in defensively and they can last forever which is super valuable for ranked.
- **Play with friends, enjoy the games you play.**  No reason to get angry at ranked, it doesn't get you anything other than a 1 way ticket to tilt city!

Hope this is helpful,

Cheers!

But blind.  I cant get my role and cant practice counter picks
I want draft normal so bad. Only way I can practice now is ranked and it just messes with my mmr and makes for a bad game for others and I've noticed many others using ranked to practice because they can guarantee their lanes

Wouldn't know, lowest rank I've ever been is B4
commit to one role, a few champs, play a lot

Hey man,

Ok so I'm not Diamond or anything so I may not have the best advice, but I did get out of Bronze so hopefully I can help you out a bit. 

The main thing that you want to focus on is **learning**. Be it learning from your mistakes, your teams mistakes, the enemies mistakes, champion selection mistakes, so on and so forth. If you have an open mind and are able to move on after a loss you will definitely make it out of bronze. 

What I mean is, when something goes wrong in a game, you need to be able to figure out what it was and how to prevent that from happening in the future. The main thing you should probably focus on is your own gameplay. Avoid getting caught, be sure to ward up (it doesn't take too much gold, and it helps), keep a positive attitude and most of all, **never give up**. 

Sounds cheesy and everyone says it, but it works, trust me. 

Best of luck with your journey through ranked mate =) 

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
With great skill and dexterity.

Your teammates will make mistakes, and sometimes these will result in your team losing the game. Equally often, the enemy players will make mistakes, which will result in your team winning the game. If you are making good calls, pinging effectively, warding well etc. your teammates will make mistakes less often than the enemy team and it will tip the odds in your favour. You can also tip the odds in your favour by winning your lane, roaming well, setting up plays etc. to make your teammates more fed than the enemy. No matter how good you are at doing these things, your teammates will still make mistakes, and you will still lose games. 
If you have done all that you can, played well all game, set up heaps of plays for your team, and you lose because some of your teammates die trying to 2v5 40 minutes into the game after you pinged them to back off, you should not be upset about losing that game because there was nothing you could do. The games you should be upset about losing are the ones where could only go even in lane, and didn't manage to get any good roams off in the first 20 minutes to help your team, or you followed your teammates in on a bad engage and turned one or two kills into an ace for the enemy, or didn't try to alert your teammate that facechecking baron by himself was a terrible idea, and especially the ones where you are doing poorly yourself and actively having a negative impact on your team. These are the games that you are losing that a better player would win. Most of the time there is something more YOU could have done to improve your chances of winning. If you want to win more you need to get better at identifying what those things are so you can do them more. Some games just aren't winnable though, you just have to accept that and not worry about those ones. Whether you notice or not, you win just as many from enemy afks and whatnot so it cancels out.
Hey man im bronze 3 And would be keen to help you climb C:

Cheers i will try. I've realised that im stuck in bronze 5 because i deserver to be there i guess. All i can do is play and have fun :)
I'm never leaving lol

Although i am getting 25 lp a win and losing 16 a loss.. i guess thats a sign im getting a little better.. "little with a grain of salt"
Play with a premade team, get 4 other guys that were good in game and add them.

My simple version is:

Installing the game will put you in bronze
Learning things like last hitting, warding and map awareness will get you near silver.
Learning team play will push you in silver
Advanced tactics will get you near gold
All this stuff can be learned.

Above gold you need all of the above and the rest is sorted out by skill and micro abilities. Can't be taught.

Eg I could train and eat well and prepare for a 100m sprint and probably beat a bunch of people in a local meet. But no amount of training will give me an edge over Usain bolt who has the training AND natural talent.

"I know i probably belong in B5"  - acknowledging that is the first and greatest step to getting better, NICE! :) Get very good at one champ http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=bear+with+me - I just watched koreans on op.gg But never blame your team, ive solo queued b1 to g5 with 94% w/r, like 56 wins 4 losses or something as singed top haha, losses being from other smurf mids and afks http://imgur.com/tSyqF8s - find a champion you love to play, not necessarily an op one that everyone is playing or one that gets banned, best of luck :)
